challenge.title: Appending Variables to Strings
challenge.description:
Just as we can build a string over multiple lines out of string literals, we can also append variables to a string using the plus equals (+=) operator.

Example:

const anAdjective = "awesome!";
let ourStr = "freeCodeCamp is ";
ourStr += anAdjective;

ourStr would have the value freeCodeCamp is awesome!.
challenge.instructions: Set someAdjective to a string of at least 3 characters and append it to myStr using the += operator.

tests.text: someAdjective should be set to a string at least 3 characters long.
You should append someAdjective to myStr using the += operator.
